Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: வகுத்தான் வகுத்த வகையல்லால் கோடி தொகுத்தார்க்கு துய்த்தல் அரிது.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Save as the 'sharer' shares to each in due degree, To those who millions store enjoyment scarce can be.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A wealthy merchant sits forlornly at a grand banquet table laden with extravagant food. He is unable to eat, as an invisible barrier separates him from the feast.
Layered_Composition.Midground: Behind him, a faint, celestial, god-like figure (The Disposer, 'வகுத்தான்') is shown measuring out a very small, simple portion of grain into a bowl for the merchant, which is the only thing he can access.
Layered_Composition.Background: A lavishly decorated hall, filled with treasures and wealth that the merchant has amassed ('கோடி தொகுத்தார்க்கு') but cannot enjoy.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The idea that one can only enjoy what has been allotted by fate, regardless of how much wealth one has accumulated.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The invisible barrier represents the limit set by fate. The celestial 'Disposer' figure symbolizes the higher power that allots each person's share. The uneaten feast represents unenjoyable wealth.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The banquet hall is richly colored and well-lit, but the merchant is cast in a somber, cool light. The celestial figure has a soft, ethereal glow.

Technical_Cues.Camera: Medium shot, focusing on the merchant's frustration and the small portion he has been given.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, ultra-realistic, with painterly effects for the celestial figure.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: High-quality, realistic lighting on the food and treasures to emphasize their desirability, contrasted with the merchant's inability to enjoy them.
Technical_Cues.Art_Genre: Allegorical realism, in the style of a Dutch still life with a metaphysical twist.

Negative_Prompt: merchant enjoying the feast, angry celestial figure, modern setting, blurry food, text artifacts.

Hyperparameters.seed: Explore variations for the appearance of the celestial 'Disposer'.
